summary: I PURCHASED A 2002 KAWASAKI ZX 12 R, THE COLOR BLUE, THIS BIKE HAS NEVER BEEN IN A ACCIDENT,  DECIDED TO CHANGE THE COLOR OF THE PLASTIC, TOOK OFF ALL PLASTIC AND FOUND A CRACK IN THE SEAM OF MY FRAME.  THE  CRACK IN THE FRAME CAUSED THE FUEL PORTS TO BE OFF-LINE AS WELL AS THE BIKE TO BE IN OPERABLE AND UNSAFE TO MYSELF OR OTHERS ON THE RROAD. WHEN I CHECKED ON THE AVAILABILITY OF A FRAME FROM KAWASAKI,  WHEN I CONTACTED KAWASAKI THEY SAID THAT THE PART IS BACKORDERED, I BELIEVE THIS IS A AN ATTEMPT NOT TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE MANUFACTURE DEFECT. I NOW HAVE A PERFECTLY AWESOME BIKE THAT'S IN OPERABLE AND UNSAFE, I AM SURE THAT THERE IS A LOT OF OTHER KAWASAKI OWNERS  WHO HAVE SUFFERED THE SAME FATE A PERFECTLY GOOD BIKE THAT DOES NOT WORK NOW BECAUSE OF OF MANUFACTURE DEFECT.
